results.question: What are the ids of all students who played video games and sports?
results.gold_sql: SELECT StuID FROM Sportsinfo INTERSECT SELECT StuID FROM Plays_games
results.predicted_sql:
WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     base."StuID" as "stu_id",
     count(distinct (plays_games_0."StuID")) as "video_game_count",
     count(distinct (sports_info_0."StuID")) as "sports_count"
  FROM (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/game_1/game_1.sqlite', 'Student')
  ) as base
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/game_1/game_1.sqlite', 'Plays_Games')
  ) AS plays_games_0
    ON (base."StuID")=(plays_games_0."StuID")
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/game_1/game_1.sqlite', 'SportsInfo')
  ) AS sports_info_0
    ON (base."StuID")=(sports_info_0."StuID")
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT 
   base."stu_id" as "stu_id"
FROM __stage0 as base
WHERE (base."video_game_count">0)and(base."sports_count">0)

results.question: Find the name of product that is produced by both companies Creative Labs and Sony.
results.gold_sql: SELECT T1.name FROM products AS T1 JOIN manufacturers AS T2 ON T1.Manufacturer  =  T2.code WHERE T2.name  =  'Creative Labs' INTERSECT SELECT T1.name FROM products AS T1 JOIN manufacturers AS T2 ON T1.Manufacturer  =  T2.code WHERE T2.name  =  'Sony'
results.predicted_sql:
WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     base."Name" as "name",
     count(distinct CASE WHEN (manufacturers_0."Name")='Creative Labs' THEN (manufacturers_0."Code") END) as "creative_count",
     count(distinct CASE WHEN (manufacturers_0."Name")='Sony' THEN (manufacturers_0."Code") END) as "sony_count"
  FROM (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/manufactory_1/manufactory_1.sqlite', 'Products')
  ) as base
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/manufactory_1/manufactory_1.sqlite', 'Manufacturers')
  ) AS manufacturers_0
    ON (base."Manufacturer")=(manufacturers_0."Code")
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT 
   base."name" as "name"
FROM __stage0 as base
WHERE (base."creative_count">0)and(base."sony_count">0)

results.question: What are the ranks of captains that are both in the Cutter and Armed schooner classes?
results.gold_sql: SELECT rank FROM captain WHERE CLASS  =  'Cutter' INTERSECT SELECT rank FROM captain WHERE CLASS  =  'Armed schooner'
results.predicted_sql:
WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     base."Rank" as "rank",
     COUNT(CASE WHEN (base."Class")='Cutter' THEN 1 END) as "cutter_count",
     COUNT(CASE WHEN (base."Class")='Armed schooner' THEN 1 END) as "schooner_count"
  FROM (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/ship_1/ship_1.sqlite', 'captain')
  ) as base
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT 
   base."rank" as "rank"
FROM __stage0 as base
WHERE (base."cutter_count">0)and(base."schooner_count">0)

results.question: Show all headquarters without a company in banking industry.

  FROM (

results.question: Which students participate in both Canoeing and Kayaking as their activities? Tell me their student ids.
results.gold_sql: SELECT T1.stuid FROM participates_in AS T1 JOIN activity AS T2 ON T2.actid  =  T2.actid WHERE T2.activity_name  =  'Canoeing' INTERSECT SELECT T1.stuid FROM participates_in AS T1 JOIN activity AS T2 ON T2.actid  =  T2.actid WHERE T2.activity_name  =  'Kayaking'
results.predicted_sql:

  SELECT 
     base."StuID" as "stu_id",
     count(distinct CASE WHEN (activity_0."activity_name")='Canoeing' THEN (participates_in_0."stuid") END) as "canoeing_count",
     count(distinct CASE WHEN (activity_0."activity_name")='Kayaking' THEN (participates_in_0."stuid") END) as "kayaking_count"
  FROM (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/activity_1/activity_1.sqlite', 'Student')
  ) as base
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/activity_1/activity_1.sqlite', 'Participates_in')
  ) AS participates_in_0
    ON (base."StuID")=(participates_in_0."stuid")
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/activity_1/activity_1.sqlite', 'Activity')
  ) AS activity_0
    ON (participates_in_0."actid")=(activity_0."actid")
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT 
   base."stu_id" as "stu_id"
FROM __stage0 as base
WHERE (base."canoeing_count">0)and(base."kayaking_count">0)

results.question: Show the names of customers who have both an order in completed status and an order in part status.
results.gold_sql: SELECT T1.customer_name FROM customers AS T1 JOIN customer_orders AS T2 ON T1.customer_id  =  T2.customer_id WHERE T2.order_status_code  =  'Completed' INTERSECT SELECT T1.customer_name FROM customers AS T1 JOIN customer_orders AS T2 ON T1.customer_id  =  T2.customer_id WHERE T2.order_status_code  =  'Part'
results.predicted_sql:
WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     base."customer_name" as "customer_name",
     count(distinct CASE WHEN customer_orders_0."order_status_code"='Completed' THEN customer_orders_0."order_id" END) as "completed_orders",
     count(distinct CASE WHEN customer_orders_0."order_status_code"='Part' THEN customer_orders_0."order_id" END) as "part_orders"
  FROM (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/customers_and_products_contacts/customers_and_products_contacts.sqlite', 'Customers')
  ) as base
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/customers_and_products_contacts/customers_and_products_contacts.sqlite', 'Customer_Orders')
  ) AS customer_orders_0
    ON base."customer_id"=customer_orders_0."customer_id"
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT 
   base."customer_name" as "customer_name"
FROM __stage0 as base
WHERE (base."completed_orders">0)and(base."part_orders">0)

    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/behavior_monitoring/behavior_monitoring.sqlite', 'Addresses')

WHERE (base."student_count">0)and(base."teacher_count">0)

results.question: What is the average number of stars that each reviewer awards for a movie?
results.gold_sql: SELECT T2.name ,  avg(T1.stars) FROM Rating AS T1 JOIN Reviewer AS T2 ON T1.rID  =  T2.rID GROUP BY T2.name
results.predicted_malloy: run: reviewer -> { group_by: reviewer_name; aggregate: avg_stars is rating.avg_stars }
results.predicted_sql:
SELECT 
   base."name" as "reviewer_name",
   (AVG(rating_0."stars")) as "avg_stars"
FROM (
  SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/movie_1/movie_1.sqlite', 'Reviewer')
) as base
 LEFT JOIN (
  SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/movie_1/movie_1.sqlite', 'Rating')
) AS rating_0
  ON (base."rID")=(rating_0."rID")
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 desc NULLS LAST
results.raw_response: run: reviewer -> { group_by: reviewer_name; aggregate: avg_stars is rating.avg_stars }

results.question: main topics of work by Brian DeRenzi
results.gold_sql: SELECT DISTINCT t1.keyphrasename  ,  SUM ( t3.numcitedby ) FROM paperkeyphrase AS t2 JOIN keyphrase AS t1 ON t2.keyphraseid  =  t1.keyphraseid JOIN paper AS t3 ON t3.paperid  =  t2.paperid JOIN writes AS t4 ON t4.paperid  =  t3.paperid JOIN author AS t5 ON t4.authorid  =  t5.authorid WHERE t5.authorname  =  "Brian DeRenzi" GROUP BY t1.keyphrasename ORDER BY SUM ( t3.numcitedby ) DESC;
results.predicted_sql:
WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     keyphrase_0."keyphraseName" as "keyphrase_name",
     count(distinct (paper_0."paperId")) as "paper_count"
  FROM (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/scholar/scholar.sqlite', 'author')
  ) as base
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/scholar/scholar.sqlite', 'writes')
  ) AS writes_0
    ON (base."authorId")=(writes_0."authorId")
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/scholar/scholar.sqlite', 'paper')
  ) AS paper_0
    ON (writes_0."paperId")=(paper_0."paperId")
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/scholar/scholar.sqlite', 'paperKeyphrase')
  ) AS paper_keyphrase_0
    ON (paper_0."paperId")=(paper_keyphrase_0."paperId")
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/scholar/scholar.sqlite', 'keyphrase')
  ) AS keyphrase_0
    ON (paper_keyphrase_0."keyphraseId")=(keyphrase_0."keyphraseId")
  WHERE (base."authorName")='Brian DeRenzi'
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT 
   base."keyphrase_name" as "keyphrase_name",
   base."paper_count" as "paper_count"
FROM __stage0 as base
ORDER BY 2 desc NULLS LAST

results.question: Show the ids of all the faculty members who participate in an activity and advise a student.
results.gold_sql: SELECT FacID FROM Faculty_participates_in INTERSECT SELECT advisor FROM Student
results.predicted_sql:
WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     base."FacID" as "fac_id",
     count(distinct (faculty_participates_in_0."FacID")) as "activity_count",
     count(distinct (student_0."StuID")) as "student_count"
  FROM (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/activity_1/activity_1.sqlite', 'Faculty')
  ) as base
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/activity_1/activity_1.sqlite', 'Faculty_Participates_in')
  ) AS faculty_participates_in_0
    ON (base."FacID")=(faculty_participates_in_0."FacID")
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/activity_1/activity_1.sqlite', 'Student')
  ) AS student_0
    ON (base."FacID")=(student_0."Advisor")
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT 
   base."fac_id" as "fac_id"
FROM __stage0 as base
WHERE (base."activity_count">0)and(base."student_count">0)

results.question: What are the first names of the professors who do not play Canoeing or Kayaking as activities?
results.gold_sql: SELECT lname FROM faculty WHERE rank  =  'Professor' EXCEPT SELECT DISTINCT T1.lname FROM Faculty AS T1 JOIN Faculty_participates_in AS T2 ON T1.facID  =  T2.facID JOIN activity AS T3 ON T2.actid  =  T2.actid WHERE T3.activity_name  =  'Canoeing' OR T3.activity_name  =  'Kayaking'
results.predicted_sql:
WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     base."Fname" as "first_name",
     count(distinct CASE WHEN (activity_0."activity_name")='Canoeing' THEN (faculty_participates_in_0."FacID") END) as "canoeing_count",
     count(distinct CASE WHEN (activity_0."activity_name")='Kayaking' THEN (faculty_participates_in_0."FacID") END) as "kayaking_count"
  FROM (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/activity_1/activity_1.sqlite', 'Faculty')
  ) as base
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/activity_1/activity_1.sqlite', 'Faculty_Participates_in')
  ) AS faculty_participates_in_0
    ON (base."FacID")=(faculty_participates_in_0."FacID")
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/activity_1/activity_1.sqlite', 'Activity')
  ) AS activity_0
    ON (faculty_participates_in_0."actid")=(activity_0."actid")
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT 
   base."first_name" as "first_name"
FROM __stage0 as base
WHERE (base."canoeing_count"=0)and(base."kayaking_count"=0)

results.question: What are the names of ships that are commanded by both captains with the rank of Midshipman and captains with the rank of Lieutenant?
results.gold_sql: SELECT t1.name FROM ship AS t1 JOIN captain AS t2 ON t1.ship_id  =  t2.ship_id WHERE t2.rank  =  'Midshipman' INTERSECT SELECT t1.name FROM ship AS t1 JOIN captain AS t2 ON t1.ship_id  =  t2.ship_id WHERE t2.rank  =  'Lieutenant'
results.predicted_sql:
WITH __stage0 AS (
  SELECT 
     base."Name" as "ship_name",
     count(distinct CASE WHEN (captain_0."Rank")='Midshipman' THEN (captain_0."Captain_ID") END) as "midshipman_count",
     count(distinct CASE WHEN (captain_0."Rank")='Lieutenant' THEN (captain_0."Captain_ID") END) as "lieutenant_count"
  FROM (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/ship_1/ship_1.sqlite', 'Ship')
  ) as base
   LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT * FROM sqlite_scan('/workspace/spider_db/spider/database/ship_1/ship_1.sqlite', 'captain')
  ) AS captain_0
    ON (base."Ship_ID")=(captain_0."Ship_ID")
  GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT 
   base."ship_name" as "ship_name"
FROM __stage0 as base
WHERE (base."midshipman_count">0)and(base."lieutenant_count">0)
